obville.chat.no_bandits: You better take that off. Otherwise you're wasting your breath. I won't talk with someone who can't look me in the eyes.
obville.messages.not_now: You may not speak to the leader now
obville.messages.need_to_talk: Hey, I heard you have been causing trouble. I need to know what's going on, so we need to talk, now.
gui.obville.config.title: Observant Villagers Config
text.survive.survival_guide.landing: This book acts like a wiki of sorts and gives you basic information on how certain mechanics in this mod works
book.survive.category.food.name: Hunger & Thirst
book.survive.category.food.desc: Tips on how to manage your hunger and thirst
book.survive.entry.overeating.name: Overeating/drinking
book.survive.entry.overeating.page.1: This mod grants the ability to eat and drink beyond the capacity of your stomach which unfortunately means you'll need to watch the amount you attempt to stuff down your throat. The feature can be disabled in the server configuration files, but if you do decide to play along here are the details of how the feature works. If you're familiar with vanilla
book.survive.entry.overeating.page.2: then you'd know that the maximum amount of hunger points you're able to get is 20, this feature changes it by raising that limit to 40 but with a catch. The moment your hunger goes beyond 20, you get a "Stomach Ache" debuff which reduces your movement speed. For every 4 points above 20 that you go, you get an extra stack of the debuff and if you hit 40, you start to take severe damage. With all the downsides of this feature, there is one singular upside.
book.survive.entry.overeating.page.3: If you fill your hunger bar to exactly 20 points, you get a "Well Fed" buff which increases your stamina regeneration and grants a very slight movement and attack buff while it's active. The same applies to thirst, with the exception of the "Well Fed" buff
